org.threadly.litesockets

Class UDPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Server
      • org.threadly.litesockets.UDPServer

  • public class UDPServer
extends Server
    A Simple UDP Server. This is a UDP socket implementation for litesockets. This UDPServer is treated like a TCPServer. It will notify the ClientAcceptor any time a new unique ip:port send a packet to this UDP socket. The UDPServer does not technically "Accept" new connections it just reads data from the socket and that data also has the host/port of where it came from. You can also just create a UDPClient from a server to initiate a connection to another UDP server, if that server sends data back from that same port/ip pair it will show up as a read in the created client.

      • acceptChannel

        public void acceptChannel(java.nio.channels.SelectableChannel c)
        Description copied from class: Server

        This is how the extending server receives the SelectableChannel. At this point it needs to do what is needed to turn this Channel into A Client object for this type of server.

        Parameters:
        c - The SelectableChannel that was just accepted by this Server.

      • getServerType

        public WireProtocol getServerType()
        Description copied from class: Server

        This is used by the SocketExecuter to know how to handle this Server when its added to it. Currently only UDP or TCP.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        returns the type of protocol this socket uses.

      • setClientAcceptor

        public void setClientAcceptor(Server.ClientAcceptor clientAcceptor)
        Description copied from class: Server

        Set the Server.ClientAcceptor for this Server. This should be set before the Server is added to the SocketExecuter. If its not you could miss pending client connections.

        Overrides:
        setClientAcceptor in class Server
        Parameters:
        clientAcceptor - Sets the Server.ClientAcceptor callback for this server.
